bug.short_desc: IE error "The data necessary to complete this operation is not yet available" reading the response text

long_desc.thetext: In rare cases we receive such an error on AJAX request in Internet Explorer 7 when we try to read the response. Unfortunately there is no reproducible scenario available. We read the response text when the "complete" event is fired. It seems that the "complete" event is fired before the readyState become 4 in IE. Looking at the Exchange#wasSuccessful there is one suspicious place where the method returns true if readyState is different than 4 - the case with status code -1.

Not being easily reproducible may make it hard to track down the issue. Ivan, any chance you come up with a scenario?
Do some of the "transport/RPC guys" (e.g. Derrell, Andreas, Alex) have observed such an issue or have an idea? It may be happening in 0.8.x as well, since the underlying code may not have changed?

Could someone of the "transport/RPC guys" take a look at the code in Exchange#wasSuccessful()? What does a statusCode of -1 mean? Why does statusCode == -1 and readyState < 4 return true? Could a request with statusCode -1 ever trigger a 'completed' event? The comment "// Not Available (OK for readystates: MSXML<4=1-3, MSXML>3=1-2, Gecko=1)" does not match the code below. Would it help to know the MSXML version? If so, how can it be determined?
Hm, this is still an open issue. Does anyone have an update or comments here (e.g. reproducible sample, Ivan?).

Unfortunately, there weren't any comments from the CC'ed people. I'll assign it to you Ivan, because you might have a sample to reproduce the issue now? Or you might have investigated it further. Any updates?
Maybe someone from the "transport/RPC guys" will answer the questions in comment #3.
Removing myself from CC since I can't help here. The code in question is probably Sebastian's, and I have no idea why it looks the way it does.
There haven't been any updates. I guess also not on your side, Ivan??
No... We are still waiting for "transport/RPC guys" to answer the questions in comment #3.

Just got the bug to my radar. Thanks Andreas.
It relatively easy to explain as nearly every Ajax lib has such a workaround. The issue is that in IE under some conditions a few properties throw some kind of access errors while other browser do not have an issue. "-1" is this case basically means that the browser not yet allows to access the property, but is not related to being successful or failed. As long as a request is not explicitly failed it is regarded as successfully.
Derrell, I think qx.io2 is a bit better. Especially as all the cross-browser magic is already done in qx.bom.Request. It makes it more complex when a code mix cross-browser logic and class-logic in one file. This is not the case with qx.io2.HttpRequest. It still needs further fine-tuning and testing, but I think it's a good start.
Ivan, this is still marked as NEW. Any updates, otherwise you might want to close this issue.
Closed outdated issue as wontfix, as bug became stale without feedback from assignee.
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
